title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0310

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine.
And today we have part two of our series about small talk in English.
segments.cn: 今天我们将讨论关于英语小谈的第二部分。

segments.en: That's right.
So as we mentioned, small talk are very short, quick conversations about everyday things like the weather.
segments.cn: 正如我们提到的，小谈是关于日常事务的非常简短、快速的对话，比如天气。

segments.en: And you usually have this with a colleague very quickly or a friend maybe.
segments.cn: 通常你会和同事或朋友很快进行这样的对话。

segments.en: Yeah, maybe not someone you know very well, too.
segments.cn: 是的，可能也不是你非常熟悉的人。

segments.en: Exactly.
So we're going to take a look at part two.
segments.cn: 那么我们来看看第二部分。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to the dialogue and see what's going on?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不听听对话，看看发生了什么呢？

segments.en: So, Michelle, let me introduce you to Maria.
She's my colleague from Brazil.
segments.cn: 她是我来自巴西的同事。

segments.en: Maria, this is Michelle.
Hi, Michelle.
So what do you do here in Shanghai?
I mean, what work do you do?
I work in advertising right now.
segments.cn: 我现在在广告行业工作。

segments.en: How about you?
I'm actually in the wine business.
segments.cn: 我实际上是在葡萄酒行业。

segments.en: Oh, that sounds really great.
I love wine myself.
Is this your first time to Shanghai, Maria?
segments.cn: Maria，这是你第一次来上海吗？

segments.en: No, actually, I often visit I usually come to China for business at least once a year.
segments.cn: 不，其实我经常来，我通常每年至少来中国一次。

segments.en: Also, I love the restaurants in Shanghai.
segments.cn: 而且，我喜欢上海的餐馆。

segments.en: So that's a good reason to come.
segments.cn: 所以这是个很好的理由。

segments.en: Me too.
Actually, there's a great Brazilian restaurant I recommend.
segments.cn: 其实，有一家很棒的巴西餐馆我推荐。

segments.en: I mean, the food is delicious, but the service isn't so good.
segments.cn: 我是说，食物很好，但服务不是很好。

segments.en: I often like to get together with friends and have a great barbecue there.
segments.cn: 我经常喜欢和朋友聚在一起，在那里享受美好的烧烤。

segments.en: We should go there together sometime.
segments.cn: 我们应该找个时间一起去。

segments.en: Wonderful idea.
I'd love that.
All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at some of these very interesting phrases we find in this dialogue in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看在这个对话中我们发现的一些非常有趣的短语，语言收获。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
So the first phrase we have today is from the first sentence of this dialogue.
segments.cn: 今天我们第一个短语来自这个对话的第一句。

segments.en: James says, so Michelle, let me introduce you to Maria.
That's right.
So we have the phrase introduce someone to or introduce you to.
segments.cn: 所以我们有短语“介绍某人给”或“介绍你给”。

segments.en: Okay, let me introduce you to this person.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我把你介绍给这个人。

segments.en: So Marco, let me introduce you to my friend.
segments.cn: Marco，让我把你介绍给我的朋友。

segments.en: Right.
And this is something that you say when you want to tell the person, look, I'm going, you're going to meet someone new.
segments.cn: 这是你想告诉对方的，当你想说，嘿，你将要见到一个新的人。

segments.en: Let me introduce you to my friend, Sally.
segments.cn: 让我把你介绍给我的朋友Sally。

segments.en: And this is very important because it's polite and it's a way for you to say, okay, you two don't know each other here.
segments.cn: 这很重要，因为这是礼貌的方式，让你说，好的，你们两个不认识，这里是这个人的名字。

segments.en: This is, you know, this person's name.
segments.cn: 这是这个人的名字，对吧？

segments.en: This is this person's name, right?
segments.cn: 当你介绍人或在两个不认识的人之间的情况下，这非常重要。

segments.en: That's right.
Exactly.
So let me introduce you to someone.
segments.cn: 所以让我介绍你给某人。

segments.en: Now, another key question here, I think probably one of the key questions when you meet someone new, you're talking small talk, short conversation, what do you do here?
segments.cn: 现在，这里还有一个关键问题，我认为这是你见到新朋友时的关键问题之一，你在进行小谈，短对话，你在这里做什么？

segments.en: Or what do you do?
What do you do?
So this might sound like a very strange question.
segments.cn: 这听起来可能是个很奇怪的问题。

segments.en: What do you do?
Do you watch TV?
Do you like to eat food?
No, but this means what job do you do?
segments.cn: 不，但这意味着你做什么工作？

segments.en: Right.
What type of work do you do?
Okay.
So Marco, what do you do?
I host an English podcast.
All right.
Me too.
So this is the question.
Now don't get confused.
And remember that this is the typical way of asking someone what is their job?
segments.cn: 记住，这是一种询问某人工作方式的典型方式。

segments.en: If you say, what is your job or what is your occupation?
segments.cn: 如果你说，你的工作是什么，或者你的职业是什么？

segments.en: What is your occupation?
It's too formal.
It's kind of awkward.
I don't think anyone has ever asked me what is your occupation?
segments.cn: 我不认为有人曾经问过我你的职业是什么？

segments.en: No, I rarely say that.
I almost always say, what do you do?
segments.cn: 我几乎总是说，你做什么？

segments.en: Or maybe what type of work do you do?
segments.cn: 或者也许你做什么类型的工作？

segments.en: Or what business are you in?
So this is our next phrase, actually.
segments.cn: 所以这是我们的下一个短语，实际上。

segments.en: Right.
If someone asks you, what business are you in?
segments.cn: 如果有人问你，你从事什么行业？

segments.en: Or what industry are you in?
You would say, like in this case, Maria, she is in the wine business.
segments.cn: 你会说，比如在这种情况下，Maria，她在葡萄酒行业。

segments.en: Okay, I'm in the wine business.
That means that my job has to do with selling or buying wine.
segments.cn: 这意味着我的工作与买卖葡萄酒有关。

segments.en: So if we replace the noun wine with something else, for example, clothing, I'm in the clothing business or I'm in the cheese business.
segments.cn: 所以如果我们把名词“葡萄酒”换成其他东西，比如“服装”，我在服装行业，或者我在奶酪行业。

segments.en: Exactly.
You can basically change it with anything.
segments.cn: 你基本上可以用任何东西替换。

segments.en: With any product.
I guess if if you sell computers, I'm in the computer business.
segments.cn: 我想如果你卖电脑，我在电脑行业。

segments.en: Or if you have anything to do with computers, you can say I'm in the computer business.
segments.cn: 或者如果你与电脑有关，你可以说我在电脑行业。

segments.en: Alright, so that's great.
I'm in the business.
Exactly.
Alright, so now we know what the person does.
segments.cn: 好的，所以现在我们知道这个人做什么。

segments.en: We continue asking questions, you know, we're interested, we want to keep the conversation going a little while longer.
segments.cn: 我们继续问问题，你知道，我们感兴趣，我们想让对话继续一段时间。

segments.en: We say, oh, wow, that's really great.
I love wine myself.
Then we ask, is this your first time to Shanghai?
segments.cn: 然后我们问，这是你第一次来上海吗？

segments.en: Okay, so is this your first time to Shanghai or in Shanghai?
segments.cn: 好的，这是你第一次来上海还是在上海？

segments.en: This means is this your first time to visit Shanghai?
segments.cn: 这意味着这是你第一次访问上海吗？

segments.en: That's right.
Now, the preposition here is always confusing for an ESL learner because sometimes do you say, is this your first time in Shanghai?
segments.cn: 现在，这里的介词对ESL学习者总是令人困惑，因为有时你会说，这是你第一次在上海吗？

segments.en: Is this your first time on Shanghai?
segments.cn: 这是你第一次在上海吗？

segments.en: Now we're saying to Shanghai.
So in this case, or in this type of question, both are correct.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，或者在这种类型的问题中，两者都是正确的。

segments.en: Is this your first time in Shanghai?
segments.cn: 这是你第一次在上海吗？

segments.en: Is this your first time to Shanghai?
segments.cn: 这是你第一次去上海吗？

segments.en: Alright, so I could also say, you know, if we are in Chicago, hey, Marco, is this your first time in Chicago?
segments.cn: 好的，我也可以说，你知道，如果我们在芝加哥，嘿，马尔科，这是你第一次在芝加哥吗？

segments.en: But I have to ask if we are in that city.
segments.cn: 但我必须问如果我们在那个城市。

segments.en: I can't say okay, I'm in Chicago today.
segments.cn: 我不能说好的，我今天在芝加哥。

segments.en: But Marco, is this your first time in New York?
segments.cn: 但是马尔科，这是你第一次在纽约吗？

segments.en: Because we're not in New York right now.
segments.cn: 因为我们现在不在纽约。

segments.en: Exactly.
That could be confusing.
So remember, when you ask this question, you're asking about where you are today right now.
segments.cn: 所以记住，当你问这个问题时，你是在问你今天现在在哪里。

segments.en: Exactly.
Very good.
So on that note, let's take a break.
segments.cn: 所以在这个基础上，让我们休息一下。

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue again.
And we'll be back with some more phrases.
So Michelle, let me introduce you to Maria.
segments.cn: 所以米歇尔，让我把你介绍给玛利亚。

segments.en: She's my colleague from Brazil.
segments.cn: 她是我来自巴西的同事。

segments.en: Maria, this is Michelle.
Hi, Michelle.
So what do you do here in Shanghai?
I mean, what work do you do?
I work in advertising right now.
segments.cn: 我现在在广告行业工作。

segments.en: How about you?
I'm actually in the wine business.
segments.cn: 我实际上在葡萄酒行业。

segments.en: Oh, that sounds really great.
I love wine myself.
Is this your first time to Shanghai, Maria?
segments.cn: 玛利亚，这是你第一次来上海吗？

segments.en: No, actually, I often visit.
I usually come to China for business at least once a year.
segments.cn: 我通常每年至少来中国一次出差。

segments.en: Also, I love the restaurants in Shanghai.
segments.cn: 而且，我喜欢上海的餐馆。

segments.en: So that's a good reason to come.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个很好的理由来这里。

segments.en: Me too.
Actually, there's a great Brazilian restaurant I recommend.
segments.cn: 实际上，有一家很棒的巴西餐馆我推荐。

segments.en: I mean, the food is delicious, but the service isn't so good.
segments.cn: 我是说，食物很好吃，但服务不是很好。

segments.en: I often like to get together with friends and have a great barbecue there.
segments.cn: 我经常喜欢和朋友聚在一起，在那里吃烧烤。

segments.en: We should go there together sometime.
segments.cn: 我们应该找时间一起去。

segments.en: Wonderful idea.
I'd love that.
All right, let's take a look at three more key phrases on Fluency Builder part two.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看流利构建第二部分的三个关键短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
So one phrase that we heard from this when things started to get a little bit more personal.
segments.cn: 所以我们从中听到的一个短语是，当事情开始变得更个人化时。

segments.en: Michelle said, I often like to get together with friends.
segments.cn: 米歇尔说，我经常喜欢和朋友聚在一起。

segments.en: So this phrase here is to get together with friends.
segments.cn: 所以这个短语是和朋友聚在一起。

segments.en: So to get together means to be united or go with friends somewhere.
segments.cn: 所以聚在一起意味着与朋友在某个地方团聚。

segments.en: That's right.
So we could also use the phrase to hang out.
segments.cn: 所以我们也可以使用短语“闲逛”。

segments.en: This means you're not doing anything in particular.
segments.cn: 这意味着你没有做任何特别的事情。

segments.en: You're not cooking or swimming or going shopping, but it just means you're together with your friends.
segments.cn: 你没有做饭、游泳或购物，但这只是意味着你和朋友在一起。

segments.en: You could be doing anything.
Right.
Exactly.
So even if you want to ask your friend or colleague, hey, do you want to get together after work and have a couple of drinks?
segments.cn: 所以即使你想问你的朋友或同事，嘿，你想下班后聚在一起喝几杯吗？

segments.en: All right.
That means would you like to hang out or would you like to go somewhere for a drink?
segments.cn: 这意味着你想闲逛还是想去某个地方喝一杯？

segments.en: It's very informal and it's not romantic.
segments.cn: 这非常非正式，并且不是浪漫的。

segments.en: Right.
It's just with friends.
Exactly.
So if you ask someone to get together sometime, it doesn't mean let's go out on a date.
segments.cn: 所以如果你邀请某人找时间聚在一起，并不意味着让我们约会。

segments.en: It just means, you know, let's hang out.
segments.cn: 这只是意味着，你知道，让我们闲逛。

segments.en: Let's hang out.
Let's be friends.
Okay.
Now, so they were talking about a Brazilian restaurant and James said, hey, you know, we should go there sometime.
segments.cn: 现在，他们在谈论一家巴西餐馆，詹姆斯说，嘿，你知道，我们应该找时间去那里。

segments.en: Okay.
We should go there together sometime is even like more personal.
segments.cn: 我们应该找时间一起去那里更个人化。

segments.en: This is a really common phrase and one that you guys should remember as a phrase.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常常见的短语，你们应该记住这个短语。

segments.en: Okay.
We should go there sometime.
segments.cn: 我们应该找时间去那里。

segments.en: That means that I would like to make plans with you to go to this restaurant.
segments.cn: 这意味着我想和你计划去这家餐馆。

segments.en: Right.
Exactly.
Now, if you notice the word sometime is separated, you have some and then apart.
segments.cn: 现在，如果你注意到“有时间”这个词是分开的，你有“有”和“时间”两个词。

segments.en: The other word is time.
So it's very different from sometimes.
segments.cn: 所以这与“有时”非常不同。

segments.en: Don't confuse it.
What we're saying here is when you have time, when I have time, we should go there.
segments.cn: 我们在这里说的是，当你有时间时，当我有时间时，我们应该去那里。

segments.en: It's almost like saying one time or in the future.
segments.cn: 这几乎就像说某个时候或将来。

segments.en: Sometimes it's different.
It's like I brush my teeth sometimes.
That means that... Exactly.
Not very often.
No, that's not true.
But I would like to go there sometime means, you know, it's it's a little bit vague.
segments.cn: 但我想在某个时候去那里意味着，你知道，这有点模糊。

segments.en: I don't say when, but I would like to in the future.
segments.cn: 我不说什么时候，但我想在未来去。

segments.en: Exactly.
And Michelle agrees.
She says, well, it's a wonderful idea.
segments.cn: 她说，好吧，这是个好主意。

segments.en: I'd love that.
Okay.
This is another great phrase.
segments.cn: 这是另一个很好的短语。

segments.en: Remember this as a phrase.
Would you like to go see a movie?
I'd love that.
I'd love that.
So I'd love that.
I'd love to.
These are ways of saying I like the idea.
segments.cn: 这些都是表达我喜欢这个主意的方式。

segments.en: Let's do it.
Exactly.
So it's usually in response to an invitation or suggestion.
segments.cn: 所以通常是对邀请或建议的回应。

segments.en: Yeah.
Very good.
All right.
So let's take a look at our dialogue again and review everything.
segments.cn: 那么我们再看看我们的对话，复习一下所有内容。

segments.en: And we'll be back in a bit.
So Michelle, let me introduce you to Maria.
segments.cn: 所以米歇尔，让我介绍你认识玛利亚。

segments.en: She's my colleague from Brazil.
segments.cn: 她是我来自巴西的同事。

segments.en: Maria, this is Michelle.
Hi, Michelle.
So what do you do here in Shanghai?
I mean, what work do you do?
I work in advertising right now.
segments.cn: 我现在在广告行业工作。

segments.en: How about you?
I'm actually in the wine business.
segments.cn: 我实际上是在葡萄酒行业。

segments.en: Oh, that sounds really great.
I love wine myself.
Is this your first time to Shanghai, Maria?
segments.cn: 这是你第一次来上海吗，玛利亚？

segments.en: No, actually, I often visit.
I usually come to China for business at least once a year.
segments.cn: 我通常每年至少来中国一次出差。

segments.en: Also, I love the restaurants in Shanghai.
segments.cn: 而且，我喜欢上海的餐馆。

segments.en: So that's a good reason to come.
segments.cn: 所以这是个很好的理由来这里。

segments.en: Me too.
Actually, there's a great Brazilian restaurant I recommend.
segments.cn: 实际上，有一家我推荐的很棒的巴西餐厅。

segments.en: I mean, the food is delicious, but the service isn't so good.
segments.cn: 我的意思是，食物很好吃，但服务不是很好。

segments.en: I often like to get together with friends and have a great barbecue there.
segments.cn: 我经常喜欢和朋友聚在一起，在那里吃烧烤。

segments.en: We should go there together sometime.
segments.cn: 我们应该有时间一起去那里。

segments.en: Wonderful idea.
I'd love that.
All right, so as we can see, it's very quick, small conversation, but very good phrases to talk to a stranger, to start up a small conversation.
segments.cn: 好吧，正如我们所看到的，这是一段非常简短的小对话，但是与陌生人交谈、开始小对话的很好短语。

segments.en: I think these are great too, Marco, because if you're learning English and you want to practice your speaking skills, you're not going to have many people to talk about deep things with.
segments.cn: 我认为这些也很棒，马尔科，因为如果你在学习英语并想练习口语技能，你不会有很多人可以谈论深层次的事情。

segments.en: So it's great to use with strangers or with people in your office.
segments.cn: 所以这在与陌生人或办公室的人交谈时非常好。

segments.en: That's right.
And these are common typical questions.
segments.cn: 这些都是常见的典型问题。

segments.en: And they're also appropriate to ask someone.
So obviously, if you meet someone new, you're not gonna ask them how much money they make because that's kind of inappropriate in Western culture.
segments.cn: 所以显然，如果你遇到新朋友，你不会问他们赚多少钱，因为在西方文化中这有点不合适。

segments.en: That's right.
So what we've taught you here are very polite, very common phrases.
segments.cn: 所以我们在这里教给你的都是非常礼貌、非常常见的短语。

segments.en: We hope, hope, hope that you'll go out and practice these.
segments.cn: 我们希望你能出去练习这些。

segments.en: If you have questions or comments, don't hesitate to leave them for us.
segments.cn: 如果你有问题或评论，请随时告诉我们。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
All right, we'll see you guys there.
Bye.
